meta.name: Screen Saver Delay
meta.brief: Ugh. Dude, take pride in your Work! If you do not encode the delay directly, make it useful. Do I really need to encode a 10min delay in 15s increments? Actually, the range goes up to 600s.

meta.name: Boot Password
meta.brief: Is actually stored in ASCII.

meta.name: Radio Name
meta.brief: Specifies the radio name or call.

meta.name: Enable Key Tone
meta.brief: Yikes.

meta.name: Key Lock Delay
meta.brief: Actually, the range goes up to 600s.

meta.name: LCD Shutdown Delay
meta.brief: Actually, the range goes up to 600s.

meta.name: Power Save Delay
meta.brief: Actually, the range goes up to 600s.

meta.name: Menu Exit Delay
meta.brief: Actually, the range goes up to 600s.

meta.name: Dual Channel Standby
meta.brief: Listen to both channels?

meta.name: Auto Power-Off Delay
meta.brief: Specifies the time to auto power-off in seconds.

meta.name: TX Priority
meta.brief: WTF?

meta.name: Main Channel PTT
meta.brief: Specifies which channel to key.

meta.name: Active VFO
meta.brief: Specifies which VFO is currently active. Default A.

meta.name: VFO A Default Zone Index
meta.brief: 0-based zone index.

meta.name: VFO A Channel Index
meta.brief: Holds the 0-based global channel index.

meta.name: VFO B Default Zone Index
meta.brief: 0-based zone index.

meta.name: VFO B Channel Index
meta.brief: Holds the 0-based global channel index.

meta.name: Lock Type
meta.brief: Specifies the possible locking type for the frequency range.

meta.name: Lower Frequency
meta.brief: Specifies the lower bound of the frequency range in MHz.

meta.name: Upper Frequency
meta.brief: Specifies the upper frequency bound in MHz.

meta.name: Scan Mode
meta.brief: Specifies the action taken, when a signal is found during scan.
meta.description: If Carrier, the scan halts as long as there is a carrier prenset and continues afterwards. If Time is set, the scan stops for a specified duration. If Stop is set, the scan stops and does not resume.

meta.name: Scan End Channel
meta.brief: Specifies where to switch to once the scan has ended.
meta.description: Either revert to the original channel or stay on the current one.

meta.name: Scan Hold Time
meta.brief: Specifies the scan hold time in seconds.

meta.name: Programmable Key Functions
meta.brief: These encode both short and long-press functions. So the encoding is (SK1 short, SK1 long, SK2 short, SK2 long).

meta.name: Key Function
meta.brief: Specifies the function for a key-press.

meta.name: Key Function
meta.brief: Specifies the function for a key-press.

meta.name: Frequency Input Size
meta.brief: Specifies, whether 6 or 8 digit frequencies are expected.

meta.name: TBST Frequency
meta.brief: Specifies the TBST frequency in Hz.

meta.name: Frequency Detect Range
meta.brief: WTF?

meta.name: Repeat Detect Delay
meta.brief: Specifies the delay in multiples of 100ms.

meta.name: Glitch Threshold
meta.brief: WTF?

meta.name: DMR Radio ID
meta.brief: Specifies the DMR radio ID as a 8-digit BCD in little (!) endian.

meta.name: Group Call Hang Duration
meta.brief: Specifies the group call hang duration in seconds.

meta.name: Private Call Hang Duration
meta.brief: Specifies the private call hang duration in seconds.

meta.name: Group Call Display
meta.brief: Specifies what to display during a group call.

meta.name: DTMF TX Delay
meta.brief: Delay between PTT and first DTMF tone.

meta.name: DTMF Tone Duration
meta.brief: Specifies tone duration in multiples of 10ms, with 30ms offset.
meta.description: That is, the final duration T = 30ms + 10ms * n. Valid values are 30ms - 200ms.

meta.name: DTMF Tone Pause Duration
meta.brief: Specifies the time-period between tones in multiples of 10ms with 30ms offset.
meta.description: That is, the pause duration T = 30ms + 10ms * n. With valid durations of 30ms - 200ms.

meta.name: DTMF Send
meta.brief: Specifies when to send DTMF codes

meta.name: DTMF Code Index
meta.brief: Specifies the 0-based index of the DTMF code to send.

meta.name: DTMF Enable Remote Stun and Kill
DTMF Enable Remote Calibration
meta.brief: WTF?

meta.name: DTMF Codes
meta.brief: The first 16 encode arbitrary codes. The latter 4 encode Remote Stun, Remote Kill, Remote Reset and Remote Monitor functions.

meta.name: DTMF Code
meta.brief: Any ASCII char from [0-9A-D*#].

meta.name: Code Size
meta.brief: Specifies the DTMF code length.

meta.name: Lower Scan-Range Frequency
meta.brief: Specifies the lower bound of the scan frequency range in multiple of 10Hz.

meta.name: Upper Scan-Range Frequency
meta.brief: Specifies the upper bound of the scan frequency range in multiples of 10Hz.

meta.name: Time slot or Bandwidth
meta.brief: Stores the union of time slot and bandwidth.
meta.description: If DMR channel, holds the time slot. That is 0=TS1 and 1=TS2. If FM channel, holds the band width. That is 0=Wide and 1=Narrow.

meta.name: Color code or RX Tone
meta.brief: Union of color code, RX CTCSS frequency or RX DCS codes.
meta.description: If DMR channel, just the color code. If FM channel and most significant 4 bit == 0, then no RX tone is set. If FM channel and most significant 4 bit == 1, then CTCSS frequency is stored in the least significant 12bit in multiples of 0.1Hz. If FM channel and most signifcant 4 bit == 2, then non-inverted DCS code is stored in binary. That is 023N is stored as 0213h. If FM channel and most signifcant 4 bit == 3, then inverted DCS code is stored in binary. That is 023I is stored as 0313h.

meta.name: RX Frequency
meta.brief: Specified in multiples of 10Hz

meta.name: TX Frequency
meta.brief: Specified in multiples of 10Hz

meta.name: Promiscuous Mode or TX Tone
meta.brief: This integer field stores the promiscuous mode setting for DMR and RX CTCSS/DCS setting for FM channels.
meta.description: If DMR channel and 0, the promiscuous mode is disabled. If 1, it is enabled. If FM channel and the most significant 4bit = 0, TX tone is disabled. If FM channel and the most significan 4bit = 1, the TX CTCSS frequency is stored in the lower 12bit in terms of multiples of 0.1Hz. If FM channel and most significant 4bit = 2, the non-inverted DSC code is stored in binary in the lower 12bit. That is, 023N is stored as 0213h. If FM channel and most significant 4bit = 3, the inverted DSC code is stored in binary in the lower 12bit. That is, 023I is stored as 0313h.

item.name: Color code/CTCSS
item.description: Meaning depends on the channel type.

meta.name: Exclude from scan
meta.brief: Excludes this channel from scan.

meta.name: Transmit timeout
meta.brief: 0=Off, 1=5s, 2=10s, 3=15s, 4=30s, 5=45s, ..., 42=600s So, except for the first two, it is in steps of 15s.

meta.name: Encryption Key Index
meta.brief: 0 = Off, index+1.

meta.name: Channel Name
meta.brief: Specifies the channel name.

meta.name: Zone bank
meta.brief: Holds all 256 zones.

meta.name: Channel count
meta.brief: Yes, again.

meta.name: Channel index
meta.brief: If not used, set to ffffh.

meta.name: Index (LSB)
meta.brief: Contains only the least significant byte of the contact index + 1.
meta.description: This field is set irrespective of whether the contact is valid or not.

meta.name: DMR ID
meta.brief: Specifies the DMR ID in 8 digit BCD little endian!
meta.description: If call type is all-call, the stored number is aaaaaaaah.

meta.name: Index
meta.brief: Stores the index+1 of the group list. May also be used to indicate valid group lists.

meta.name: Unknown integer
meta.brief: Always set to 1

meta.name: Group Call Index
meta.brief: Specifies the index+1 of the group call.

meta.name: Key Index (LSB)
meta.brief: Just the least signficant byte of the encryption key index + 1.
meta.description: This field is set, irrespective whether the key is valid or not.

meta.name: Key Type
meta.brief: Specifies the key type.

meta.name: Name
meta.brief: Specifies the key name.

meta.name: Keydata
meta.brief: The key data is stored as a 64/128/256 bit, big endian unsigned integer value, depending on the key type.

meta.name: Index
meta.brief: Stores the 0-based index of the message. If set to ff, message is invalid.

meta.name: Active Channel Index
meta.brief: Zero based index of the active FM channel.

meta.name: Channel Frequency
meta.brief: Specifies the frequency in 0.1MHz.
